Question
========
What best describes the Lorentz factor in the nonrelativistic limit?

Answerlist
----------
* $\gamma \approx 1$
* $\gamma \approx 0$
* $\gamma \approx c$
* $\gamma \rightarrow \infty$


Solution
========
The Lorentz factor is defined to be

$$ \gamma = \frac{1}{\sqrt{1 - v^2 / c^2}} $$
In the nonrelativisitc limit, $v \ll c$ so $v^2 / c^2 \approx 0$ and

$$ \gamma \approx \frac{1}{\sqrt{1 - 0}} = 1 $$
